titles.title: Healthy Meals for Children Act
Healthy Meals for Children Act
Healthy Meals for Children Act
To amend the National School Lunch Act to provide greater flexibility to schools to meet the Dietary Guidelines for Americans under the school lunch and school breakfast programs.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities. Oversight, the Budget, and Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

action.text: Subcommittee on Early Childhood, Youth and Families Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Economic and Educational. H. Rept. 104-561.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 274.

action.text: Mr. Clinger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 5/14/1996--Passed House amended. Healthy Meals for Children Act - Amends the National School Lunch Act to permit schools to use any reasonable approach to meet certain school lunch and breakfast dietary guidelines, including use of the 1994-1995 school nutrition meal pattern. Prohibits schools from being required to use or conduct nutrient analysis.
